official_title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the United States Office of Special Counsel, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Whistleblower Protection Act of 1989 to extend the authorization of appropriations for the U.S. Office of Special Counsel (OSC). Makes miscellaneous and technical amendments to various OSC provisions of such Act, including those regarding investigation of prohibited personnel practices and individual rights of action in certain reprisal cases. Amends Federal law to make an agency decision to order psychiatric testing or examination of an employee a personnel action subject to review in whistleblower cases. Requires OSC to issue a policy statement regarding the implementation of the Whistleblower Protection Act of 1989, to be made available to each person alleging a prohibited personnel practice. Makes agency heads responsible for ensuring that agency employees are informed of their rights and remedies under the Whistleblower Protection Act of 1989.

titles.title: A bill to authorize appropriations for the United States Office of Special Counsel, and for other purposes.
